body_html:
@gunan @jart I'm not suggesting to push this into trunk, but provides a quick hacking solution for whom has this problem now. Of course, comment out the gcs rule is much more easier.

We use this approach internally because the library we need to integrate is really nasty to convert to normal Bazel rule and we don't want to invest too much time on this because we don't use bazel except tensorflow.

@gunan @jart I'm not suggesting to push this into trunk, but provides a quick hacking solution for whom has this problem now. Of course, comment out the gcs rule is much more easier.
We use this approach internally because the library we need to integrate is really nasty to convert to normal Bazel rule and we don't want to invest too much time on this because we don't use bazel except tensorflow.
body:
@gunan @jart I'm not suggesting to push this into trunk, but provides a quick hacking solution for whom has this problem now. Of course, comment out the gcs rule is much more easier.

We use this approach internally because the library we need to integrate is **really nasty** to convert to normal Bazel rule and we don't want to invest too much time on this because we don't use bazel except tensorflow.
